meanings.definition: Capable of being debated or argued
meanings.sent1: The topic was rebatable among the students, leading to a lively discussion.
meanings.sent2: It is rebatable whether cats or dogs make better pets.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a pizza party every day was rebatable but ultimately impractical.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her job was rebatable, causing a stir among her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The rebatable nature of the new policy made it difficult to reach a consensus.

meanings.definition: Subject to being refunded or credited back
meanings.sent1: The rebatable product could be returned for a full refund within 30 days.
meanings.sent2: The store had a clear policy on rebatable items, ensuring customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: He found it amusing that the rebatable sweater he returned ended up being on sale the next day.
meanings.sent4: The rebatable nature of the coupon made it a valuable find for savvy shoppers.
meanings.sent5: Returning the rebatable item was a simple process thanks to the store's efficient system.
